messages.title: VOTE FOR WHAT YOU BELIEVE IN
messages.content: We believe in a political system that puts the public first. An economy that gives everyone their fair share. A society capable of supporting people's needs. A planet protected from the damage we do to it. Vote for what you believe in. Vote Green.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Publicly funded NHS, publically provided education, end of tax evasion, and £10 minimum wage.
Build 500,000 social rental homes, abolish right to buy, and bring empty homes back into use.
Take serious action on climate change by working with other countries to ensure global temperatures do not rise beyond 2 degrees.
Scrap university tuition fees, provide comprehensive school syllabus free of cost, and schools to be under Local Authority control.
Return the railways to public hands, invest in public transport, and promote walking and cycling.

mentions.candidate: Jane Pickard, your Green Party candidate for Newbury West

issues.economy: Fair economy that will end tax evasion and tax avoidance
issues.education: Free education - no tuition fees and comprehensive academic syllabus available to all
issues.environment: Serious action on climate change with international cooperation
issues.health: Ensure a publicly funded, publicly provided National Health Service (NHS) with no sell-offs

housing.content: Build 500,000 social rental homes that are affordable, abolish the right to buy, and bring empty homes back into use.

leaflet.personalStatement: Just ask anyone who has worked with me: I’m hardworking, committed and enthusiastic, with a deep love of West Berkshire.

contactInformation.address: Newbury and West Berkshire Green Party, 18 Carnarvon Place, Newbury RG14 5NA

images.caption: Jane Pickard standing outside in a rural setting
Caroline Lucas and Natalie Bennett smiling together

leaflet.additionalNotes: This Green Party leaflet covers topics such as the NHS, education, housing, the economy, and climate action. The messages emphasize the public-first political system and the economic fairness aspect of their policies. It contains personal statements by the candidate, Jane Pickard, emphasizing her commitment to the local area.
